rule: If the chatbot is unable to process or determine the part of speech for the provided word, the output must not be "CantAnswer"; it must instead provide an explanation or reasoning in multi-line text.
input: sentence: They wanted to synchronize., word: synchronize
validityText:
The input provides a sentence and a word. The sentence "They wanted to synchronize." is grammatically valid and contains the word "synchronize" as a substring. There are no special characters or symbols that violate the specification. The word "synchronize" does not include punctuation. Thus, the input complies with all given rules.
OK
coverageEvalText:
The chatbot output provides a single word, "VERB", which is a valid part-of-speech tag listed in the description. The output strictly adheres to the instruction to return only the part-of-speech tag.
OK
